pr_title: GEODE-7979: Implement a test class for the PERSIST Redis API command

timeline.bodyText: why is this so high?  do we even need to set this below, or can we rely on the default?
timeline.author: prettyClouds

replies.bodyText: I set it to the default from awaitility.  I'll double check with the team though.  For some reason I remember us having to set it really high, but it may not be necessary for Persist.
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: i think this should be a local variable to the concurrent test, not a global to this whole class.
timeline.author: prettyClouds

replies.bodyText: Sounds good, just made it local.
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: can you rename this to element or set_element...it is really hard to distinguish this test from the one above without looking VERY carefully
timeline.author: prettyClouds

replies.bodyText: Just put an underscore before the data types and updated the key and value names.  Does that help in distinguishing?
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText:
where's the blocking queue here?  this name may be a relic, and needs to be updated?
"do a bunch of" is odd.  maybe the method is just expireKeys, and  below one is persistKeys
timeline.author: prettyClouds

replies.bodyText: It was a relic! We forgot to rename the method names.  Thank you!  As far as "do a bunch of", we were following a naming convention from a few other test suites.  I changed it though.  Maybe we should discuss as a team or rename the other methods as well?
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: I think you should use the actual Command class and not a mock.  I tried it out and the tests are simpler. Give it a try and see what you think.
timeline.author: prettyClouds

replies.bodyText: We wanted the unit test to remain pure and only test the relevant executor.  We also mock the Command class in other JUnit tests.  We could bring this up at techtro though if we want to change the way we're doing the executor unit tests?
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: is this test still a work in progress? I don't see that it tests anything
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: It actually runs all the PersistIntegrationTests against native Redis running in a Docker container.
replies.author: sabbey37
